oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of the springhouse, an elderly African American man, a group of Clarksville children, the Nashville Water Works, a Postmaster and his wife, and a drawing of the proposed Howard Elementary School. Nashville Banner, 1931 August 16.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Russell, Tom; Jordan, Dorothy; Ely, John; Atkinson, Mary; Altus, Mrs. William; Jordan, Garland; McReynolds, Robert L.; McReynolds, Sarah; Culberson, Mrs. James M.; Rogers, Sam L.; Rogers, Mrs. Sam L.
Nashville Banner
Group portraits; Children; Buildings; Springhouses
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a springhouse on the grounds of the B. A. Chalfant home on Murfreesboro Pike, an elderly African American man near Denver, Tennessee, a group of Clarksville children (grown at the time of publication), an aerial picture of the Nashville Water Works, a Montgomery County Postmaster and his wife, and a Tisdale & Pinson drawing of the proposed Howard Elementary School. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Stephens, Guy C.; West, J. Frank
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
